intro: Senra incana, commonly known as the silverleaf senra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Senra incana is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
